subgoal: Gather and prepare ingredients: bacon (or pancetta or guanciale), Pecorino Romano cheese, Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, eggs, fresh ground black pepper, spaghetti (or pasta), kosher salt, and optionally olive oil and garlic.
original_subgoals: Gather the ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta), pecorino romano cheese, free-range organic eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.
Gather ingredients: thick-cut bacon (or pancetta), Pecorino Romano cheese, Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, eggs, fresh ground black pepper, spaghetti, kosher salt, and olive oil (optional).

subgoal: Chop or slice the bacon or guanciale into pieces.
original_subgoals: Cut guanciale (pork cheek) into chunks. Pancetta can be used as an alternative.
Prepare the guanciale by removing the skin and slicing it into 1 cm thick pieces, then chop into 0.5 cm chunks.
Slice about half a pound of bacon into thick pieces, approximately three-quarters of an inch wide.
Chop up some bacon.

subgoal: Cook the bacon or guanciale in a pan until crispy, optionally using a bit of olive oil, and reserve some for garnish. Optionally, add garlic to infuse flavor and remove it once the bacon or guanciale is golden.
original_subgoals: Heat olive oil in a pan and add the guanciale to start the sauce.
If desired, remove excess fat from the guanciale using a paper towel.
Place a cold pan on medium-high heat and add the guanciale to render the fat.
Crack a garlic clove and add it to the pan to infuse the fat with its aroma.
Once the guanciale is golden, remove the garlic from the pan.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add a tiny bit of olive oil (optional).
Add the bacon to the pan and slowly render out the fat until the bacon is crispy. Reserve some bacon for garnish.
Once the bacon is rendered, turn off the heat and drain most of the fat, leaving about two tablespoons in the pan.
Cook the bacon in a pan and then turn off the heat to let it cool.

subgoal: Separate egg yolks from egg whites and whisk together with whole eggs (if using), then grate and add Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese to the egg mixture. Optionally, use only Pecorino Romano. Add fresh ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture.
original_subgoals: In a bowl, beat two egg yolks (for two people). Do not add cream.
Add grated parmesan (or pecorino cheese) and abundant pepper to the egg yolks and mix to create the sauce.
Crack the eggs into a bowl and add about 20 grams of pecorino romano cheese. Whisk together.
Grate about three ounces each of Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese using a fine grater.
In a bowl, whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
Gradually whisk the grated cheese into the egg mixture until well combined.
Separate egg yolks from egg whites using the thumb trick or back and forth method.
Grate pecorino romano cheese into the egg yolks.
Crush black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sieve to separate the hotter inner part from the milder outer skin.
Add fresh ground black pepper to the egg and cheese mixture to taste.
Add pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture.

subgoal: Boil water, add salt, and cook spaghetti or pasta until al dente.
original_subgoals: Boil water and add salt at a ratio of 10 grams per liter.
Add spaghettoni (or large spaghetti) to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Do not add oil.
Fill a pot with water, add a tiny amount of salt, and bring it to a boil.
Twist the pasta and add it to the boiling water to prevent sticking. Cook for 8 minutes.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and add about a tablespoon of kosher salt to four quarts of water.
Add the spaghetti to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes until slightly al dente.
Boil water, add salt, and cook spaghetti in it.

subgoal: Reserve some pasta water, then drain the spaghetti or pasta.
original_subgoals: Check the pasta for doneness and drain when ready.
Reserve some pasta water and drain the spaghetti.

subgoal: Transfer the cooked spaghetti or pasta to the pan with bacon or guanciale fat (heat off) and mix with the bacon or guanciale.
original_subgoals: Add the cooked pasta to the pan with the guanciale and mix to flavor the pasta.
Turn off the heat under the pan with guanciale and add the cooked pasta directly from the pot, along with some pasta water, to the pan.
Transfer the spaghetti to the pan with the bacon fat (heat still off).
Transfer cooked spaghetti directly from the water into the bacon pan.

subgoal: Add the egg and cheese mixture to the hot spaghetti or pasta, stirring gently to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs. Add reserved pasta water as needed to achieve a creamy sauce consistency.
original_subgoals: Allow the pasta to cool slightly before adding the egg mixture to prevent scrambling.
Add the egg mixture to the pasta and stir to coat the pasta, creating a creamy sauce.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pan, tossing the pasta to combine and create a creamy texture without scrambling the eggs.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the hot spaghetti, stirring gently to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs.
Mix the spaghetti with the bacon and add the egg yolk and cheese mixture.
Stir the pasta and guanciale, allowing the water and fat to emulsify into a creamy sauce.
Adjust the sauce consistency by adding more pasta water if needed.
If needed, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce and achieve a creamy consistency.
Add a bit of pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese.
Add more pasta water to the pan to make the sauce creamy.

subgoal: Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated cheese and crispy bacon or guanciale pieces. Finish with additional pepper and serve immediately.
original_subgoals: Finish with additional parmesan or pecorino cheese and a touch of pepper for decoration.
Plate the pasta and garnish with additional grated Parmigiano Reggiano and crispy bacon pieces.
Finish the dish with additional cracked black pepper and a sprinkle of pecorino romano cheese.
Serve immediately and enjoy with friends or family.
Serve immediately and enjoy.
Finish with additional pepper and grated pecorino or parmesan cheese.
